result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Oesterreich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:09 pm
Defendant Andrew J Oesterreich in court without counsel.
Defendant makes statement regarding ability to pay and offers to pay $100 by March 31, 2017.
Court orders Defendant to pay $50 bi-weekly, beginning March 31, 2017, and continuing every other Friday, until paid in full.  Court authorizes Warrant - stayed, pending compliance with payment plan.
Court adjourned at 1:10 pm
FTP Hearing March 27, 2017, for $328.50

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew J Oesterreich
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, c/o Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 08-30-2016)
Prior: 333 Robbins St, Seymour, WI 54165 United States

3:58 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2016CM55 and count 1 on 2016CM50, with the balance of the counts being dismissed and read-in.   State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2016CM50, strikes the repeater and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2016CM55, strikes the repeater and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with the victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CM50(Obstructing)

-90 days county jail, with huber and consecutive to any other sentence.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2016CM55 (Resisting)

-120 days county jail, with huber and consecutive to any other sentence.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 4:09 p.m.

2:05 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  No objection by either counsel to hold the initial on 2016CM50 today.  2016CM50 & 2016CM55 - Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaints and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count/case and as repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat will be representing the defendant and enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500 signature bond on each case and condition of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department..  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 5, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:09 p.m.
